qas.question: What did Burke think the war with France was against?
Burke hoped which country wouldn't be partitioned?
What kind of empire did Burke think the French revolutionaries wanted?
Who did Burke think the war was against, rather than France as a whole?
What type of doctrine did Burke propose?
What country did Burke want partitioned?
What kind of empire did Burke think Europe would become?
What did Burke say France was trying to extend?

context: This is held to be the first explanation of the modern concept of totalitarian state. Burke regarded the war with France as ideological, against <a0_0>an "<b4_0>armed doctrine<b4_0/>"<a0_0/>. He wished that <a1_0><b5_0>France<b5_0/><a1_0/> would not be partitioned due to the effect this would have on the balance of power in Europe, and that the war was not against France, but against <a3_0>the revolutionaries governing her<a3_0/>. Burke said: "It is not France extending <b7_0>a foreign empire<b7_0/> over other nations: it is a sect aiming at <a2_0><b6_0>universal<b6_0/><a2_0/> empire, and beginning with the conquest of France".
